1.content:
Russell Franco started this day in prison just like any other day. He awoke at six o'clock, worked out, showered, and joined other prisoners at the lunch hall for breakfast. After his horrid breakfast, Russell went back to his cell. While walking back to his room, a strange new prisoner caught his attention. This new man was small and dinky in comparison to the rest of the prisoners, and he was also wearing a straightjacket. Russell was puzzled as to why this man was restrained, so of course he went to talk to the man.

"Hey there ol' man, you must be new here," said Russell to the new prisoner.

"Well hello there Russell," responded the gypsy.

"How do you know my name?" asked Russell

"You seen young boy, I know everything about you, and I know how badly you want to escape from this hell hole."

"Yeah I do, but don't we all?" said Russell

"But you know what?" asked the gypsy, "Something is different about you, something is definitely different about you"

"What do you mean?" asked Russell

"I believe that you should leave her, I mean come on, I know you don't want to be here"

"Yeah, you're right, but how could I escape from here? Nobody makes it out of here alive" said Russell

"Talama Quoe Choo Chaa" chanted the gypsy, "Talama Quoe Choo Chaa!"

Just as the gypsy finished his chants and rituals, Russell collapsed on the ground, drawing the attention of fellow prisoners and of course the guards and other workers.

111132.content:
Russell thought for a moment. Briscle. This was the police officer who had got him locked up for something he hadn't done. She'd set him up for a crime he didn't commit on behalf of a criminal gang. She'd even laughed about it to his face. But Kate Briscle was a petite career officer with an angelic, round face and neat, straight brown locks that made her look sweet and honest - a perfect disguise for a dirty cop who had taken a pay-off from a low level gangster to get Russell out of the picture.

He hadn't ratted, though. You never rat. And nobody would believe a supposed criminal that a cop was dirty. So even when she'd told him, to his face, that "the Lupinos gave their regards", and laughed about it in front of him, he had kept silent.

Now the tables had turned. The only problem was that he had no idea where Briscle lived, or even which precinct she worked in. And the bodies didn't seem to come with any memories that would make it easy to find out.

He sighed, floating along the street, before spotting a young man standing looking at his cell. "Great," Russell said, jumping into his new host. In the blink of an eye he shook, and found himself clutching the phone. Quickly he swiped away from the text message his host had been reading, and accessed the internet and the phone directory.

Briscle... Briscle... Briscle KT. he grinned as he spotted the address. He recognized it, too. With a final shake he exited his temporary host, leaving the young man bewildered as to what he'd been searching for online. Then, taking a deep breath, Russell stepped out into the road, watching a car speed toward him.

"I hope this works..." he muttered as he waited for the car to hit him... only for it to fly straight through his ghost-like form. Suddenly he was in the driver seat, sat in the body of a middle-aged man dressed in a business suit.

"Wow," he muttered with his new voice. "I guess it did."

It didn't take long to turn to Briscle's street, and then he left the driver, lost on a road he didn't recognize. He watched as the man looked puzzled, and began to drive down the street trying to find a turn off back to the main road. Russell sniggered, and turned his attention to the houses. It looked like a quiet neighborhood, with small gardens and neatly trimmed lawns. Exactly the kind of place Briscle would live, he thought, wondering what he was going to do exactly. Fuck with her somehow, but quite how he didn't know. Maybe possess people around her, scare her, drive her paranoid? Maybe possess her and commit some crime - maybe even rob the bank he supposedly robbed. Or he could impersonate Briscle and find out why he'd been framed and put in jail. It would be hard without access to her memories, though...

He sighed, and thought about it for a moment, watching as a delivery driver pulled up with a package for a house down the street. Suddenly he had an idea. Rushing forward, Russell dived in to the driver's stomach, causing the man to twitch slightly as he took control of his frame. Now, with package in hand, he walked up to Briscle's house and rang the doorbell.

The door opened and a woman answered. She wasn't Briscle, but had the same round, friendly face and small frame. She was hot, Russell decided, probably in her mid-20s, with her brunette locks cut in long, thick bangs, and her eyes hidden behind thick-framed glasses. He smiled and offered a greeting.

"Hi m'am. I've got a package for a Kate Briscle?"

"Oh?" The woman replied. "I can take that if you want."

"And you are?" He asked. The woman smiled.

"I'm her sister."

Russell laughed. "Perfect," he said. Within seconds he had flown out of the delivery driver and in to the waiting woman. He felt his new body convulse, and let out a gasp as he felt body parts he'd never had before. The sensations rushed over him, making him blush as he caught his - her - breath and straightened his - her - glasses. The delivery driver stood there, unsure.

"Oh, no. That's for number 29. Down the road," he said, faking the woman's friendly smile. The driver nodded, apologized, and left. Then Russell closed the door, and strode in to the house. "Now," he muttered. "Let's find out who I am." It didn't take long to find 'her' wallet, and her phone wasn't locked. A quick read of her driver ID and emails revealed everything. Russell was now Emily Briscle, Kate's 24-year-old younger sister. Emily was in town visiting for a few days.

Russell smiled and stared at Emily's face in her compact, pouting her lips, combing her bangs. He could easily stay as Emily, have a little fun, maybe get the younger sister in trouble until Kate came. Or he could simply wait. He'd been in jail too long, and now he had everything he could want: food, drink, TV, the internet. He could hang around as Emily until officer Briscle came home.

And then he could get payback.

"I hope you are okay!"

You smiled back dejected, you realized that you may have to begin playing a character when in a body, it's not that it would be a problem, who would ever believe that you weren't Joyce there was no way to prove otherwise, but you could do without any awkward moments, thinking it's easier not to lie and avoid spoiling the illusion.

Luckily the concussion began to lift, you began to see more clearly being able to properly see the road ahead of you and also Tiffany's face, it was pretty but like the other nurses plain, t was a rule that the nurses couldn't wear make-up. when working with inmates, looking at boring as possible was the best thing to do especially to horny prisoners. you wondered how long your co-escapee had his powers, surely if he had had it for long he wouldn't have been locked up, yet on the other side of the coin, maybe this was his plan to get thrown in prison to find you, or possess his way into prison just to find you, but why would he, you never thought of yourself as special.

Leaving your body behind may have been a mistake, but logically if you had to leave your body, it would mean that every time you fancied a ride in someone your body would collapse and you'd have to repossess it at the hospital or worse the morgue. It's arguable that you could just put your body at your house and go for a spree of possessions but it just means that you are chained to something.

This ride wa fun because in truth you didn't know where you were going. This became very apparent when you entered a drive way.

"Where are we?"

The only benefit to being hit in the head s that question was not odd at all, you could play it off as genuine confusion.

"We're at mine, silly". She seemed so lovely, you could see that she was a good friend which made whatever part of you that still experienced empathy feel slightly bad, but non the less, you had plans.

"But what about clothes?"

"Aw, that other nurse must have hit you hard, you left a couple of bits of clothing last time you were over, and I've got some stuff obviously not bras..." Tiffany coughed, as if she had just stuck her foot in her mouth, you imagined from the brief time you knew her that she was very pure, yet had moments where the words flew out without them being present in the brain.

As a result of that comment your eyes drifted towards your colleges chest, you noticed that she was better endowed than you, whilst you did this a weak laugh escaped your mouth.

Rather than say anything further, she headed towards the brown front door, grabbing her key and thrusting it into the lock, she appeared to be muttering something to herself, as if she was telling herself off.
1121.title: Russell goes to Joyce's home.

1122.content:
" I'm not really feeling this body . " , Russell said with Joyce's voice . He concentrated a bit and he began to phase out of her body. When he left Joyce's body, it immediately fell on the floor unconscious. " It must be because she was unconscious when I possessed her body. " , he thought to himself.

" I need a new body . " , he thought and began to float away, he wondered if he should posses one of the officers and stick around or just leave the prison and find a body outside.
1122.title: Russell leaves Joyce's body.

113.content:
"I think its payback time. Let 's go get captain Brooks and give him a little farewell gift for the treatment I got here. "Russell told the old man but once he turned back, the old man is gone. "Oh well " he said and went to the captain's office.

As he got there, he found the 6ft blond officer doing paperwork."At least you got what you deserve " he thought before he flew into him. After some struggling he totally gained his body. Not long after, a painful headache hits and he gained the officer 's memories. He decided to....
113.title: Not so powerful now, are you?

1131.content:
"You messed with the wrong man Captain Brooks. You fucking bastard." Russell said as he stood up from the desk and thought out his next move. Ever since Russell had arrived here, Captain Brooks seemed hellbent on making Russell's life miserable, so Russell planed on returning the favor.

1. Stay here at the prison and screw up Captain Brooks life at work.

2. Go to his house and screw up Captain Brooks home life.

3. Think your next moves over more.
1131.title: Screw his live

choices: Sex with one or more of his Daughters
11312.content: You remember that Captain Brooks has two daughters and a wife, You could mess up his family by knocking up one of his daughter or you could mess with his wife.
11312.title: Home Life.

choices: Officer Loggins, the cutest little officer you ever could see
114.content:
He didn't know how long this could last for, he could only have one chance for a new life. He didn't want to be some pussy-ass staff member so he was gonna possess an officer, one of those violent bastards who were all too happy to make use of those sticks of you if you blinked wrong. Maybe being a chick would be fun, help him get away from his old life some more. With one glance over to the Gypsy, he began to think about which Guards fitted his choice.

There was Officer Contreras, a Latino woman. She was petite, well built and was well known for being all to keen with that night stick on the male prisoners balls, giving her the nickname "Ball-buster," Then there was Officer Loggins. She was a quite cute looking blonde woman who manned the security cameras and was the opposite of what you'd expect for a prison guard; short, blonde, cute and very curvy. She even had an adorable little squeaky voice that was so damn cute and hot at the same time. Finally, there was Officer Brooks. She was an ex-competitive weight lifter and looked the part; tall, bulky and African American, she was like an Amazonian warrior or something.
114.title: Possess a female officer

choices: He lays in his bed trying to discover what happened
He goes to the mess hall for dinner
12.content:
Russell slowly opened his eyes only to find himself back in his jail cell.

"Look who finally decided to wake up!" Said the strange gypsy man, who was standing on the outside of Russell's cell

"Alright, enough is enough! What do you want from me, and why did I faint when you did that fucking chant?" yelled Russell

"Do you want to know son, do you rally want to know?" asked the gypsy

"Just tell me everything!" screamed Russell once more

"You don't always believe everything you hear you know?" said the gypsy in a sly tone.

"God Damnit! Just tell me what you fucking did to me!"

"Alright then. I am a warlock, and I have some 'special' abilities. Now that I am in my old age, I wish to pass my abilities on to somebody else, and that somebody else is you Russell" explained the gypsy.

"BullShit!" laughed Russell, "You know, you really had me going there, for a moment, I honestly thought you were a warlock! HaHaHa!"

"It appears as if you hold doubt within you Russell, and if you don't believe me, than I can share no pity in you. You already possess the power to leave this wretched prison, and now you just have to decide if you want to leave" said the gypsy

"Alright you're real funny ol' man, real funny" muttered Russell

"Talabat Mulchen Wah!" screamed the gypsy, and just like that, he disappeared right before Russell's eyes, straightjacket and all.

"What the fuck?!?" said Russell, "Maybe that old man was on to something, maybe he did give me some powers or some shit like that. I just wonder what the fuck I can do now..."


What does Russell now do?
12.title: Russell is back in his cell

121.content: Russell just lays there on his bed for hours, still trying to peace everything together. "So that man was a gypsy." He started to say while looking up at the ceiling. "Who has given me powers to escape? What power!?" Russell yelled, sitting upright and looking over at the jail cell that the gypsy had been inhabiting only a few short hours ago. "What were the words the old man spoke.......Talabat Mulchen Wah?" As soon as Russell spoke the words he felt a sudden tingling sensation go through his entire body. "Finally you spoke the damn words! Any longer and I was planning on leaving without you" The old gypsy said. Russell was surprised to suddenly find the old man floating in the jail cell he had been in after he disappeared. "Where the hell did you come from?" Russell said, only to soon realize that he was floating above his jail cell as well. " Now then. Do you have any questions to ask me." The gypsy asked Russell, who was still freaking out over his sudden transparency. Russel looked up to face the gypsy and yelled "What the hell happened to me!?" "Stop yelling." The gypsy said, as he went straight through his cell bars and floated into Russell's cell. "How'd you do that?" Russell asked amazed. Only to reach his arm out and watch it faze through as well. "That spell me and you spoke turns the user into a spirit form permanently." The man explained. "Wait, this is permanent!" Russell began to yell. "Why would I want to be a ghost for my whole life!?" Suddenly a guard approach the two's jail cells, but was startled after finding two prisoners cells empty. "Where are they!?" He said aloud, while reaching for his walky talky.
121.title: He lays in his bed trying to discover what happ...

choices: He joins the rest of the prisoners in the yard
He goes to the infirmary to check his neck
1211.content:
All Russell saw was a blur as the gypsy jumped forwards and then a second later the guard smiled as his hand came away from the walky talky on his belt. He instead reached for his cell door keys, unlocking the door and beckoning Russell to walk through. Russell felt his body solidify again before the guard's coarse hands grabbed his own and soon Russell's hands were cuffed behind his back. "Hurry up #7285, we're going for a little WALK," the guard said, a mischievous gleam in his eye as he pushed Russell forwards.

Russell could feel the frosty glares coming at him from the other prisoners on his back that made all of his hairs stand warily. 'Psst, I know it's you in there, you gypsy bastard,' Russell whispered. 'Lemme go, man. All you gotta do is help me outta these walls and, I promise you, there's money stashed on the outside for ya. Whad'ya want, huh? 10G's? 25?'

Russell yelped as the guard hauled him face first into the cell, unsympathetic to Russell's pain. The guard clutched Russell's neck in a vice-grip, squeezing out the air slowly while dragging Russell closer to his deranged looking face. "First of all," the guard spat, "I'm NOT a freakin' GYPSY, and if you call me that even ONE more time, I'll snap EVERY. BONE. IN YOUR. BODY."

"Second, I don't care about your money: the only type of business I'm in is REVENGE. And there's a BIG market for revenge in places like this."

"B-but what have I g-got to do with any of th-this?" Russell gasped. He grabbed the guard's arm desperately in a hopeless attempt to pry off the manly paw. A smile stretched across the guard's face as he dropped an asphyxiated Russell onto the floor and left him gasping for air. "See, I knew you were a smart one."

"Have you heard any news about your pending trial date? No, of course not. Well it's been bumped up. To four days time. That's... Thursday? You're gonna go there and get all the charges dropped against you. Don't worry about the details; let's just say I've got friends in high places that are gonna help you out. Afterwards you're gonna meet me outside the 4th courthouse door. From there you'll here the rest of the plan."

"What if I don't wanna meet you outside, crap-for-brains. What the hell happens then?"

The guard grinned unnaturally as he leaned in closer to Russell's ear and whispered, "Then I'll track you down, hunt you and either kill you or drag you back by your underwear, preferably with a couple of missing teeth. Anyways, have fun for the rest of your time here with the little gift I sent you!" The guard stood up and swivelled around, leaving Russell with not only a sore neck but also a whole heap of unanswered questions.
1211.title: The gypsy moves first.

122.content: When Russell is being escorted to the mess hall by the guards, Ruselll feels a tingle,and before he knows it, all the guards around him have passed out. What does he do?
122.title: He goes to the mess hall for dinner

info.brief_description: A criminal with body possession powers has just broken free from jail...
info.description:
The main character of this story is named Russell Franco. He is in his mid-twenties, and was arrested for robbery. He was given his powers by a gypsy. That's pretty much it. Feel free to add new characters.

RULES:
Use Good Grammar
No New Powers
No Gay stuff, but lesbian is fine as usual ;)
Try to make additions at least 1 paragraph
I REWARD GPs FOR EVERY ADDITION!!!!!
email me with any questions
Have Fun!
